body_html:
Thanks for filing the issue @gibiansky!

Do you have a use-case where the current shape inference behavior is making it hard or impossible to do something? That will make it easier for us to prioritize this general class of problems.

FYI there is a trade-off between full-blown shape inference including const-propagation, vs simpler code. So it's not obvious that full-featured shape inference will always be worth it. Of course this is a philosophical statement; that's why concrete examples are always helpful to determine priorities.

body:
Thanks for filing the issue @gibiansky!

Do you have a use-case where the current shape inference behavior is making it hard or impossible to do something?  That will make it easier for us to prioritize this general class of problems.

FYI there is a trade-off between full-blown shape inference including const-propagation, vs simpler code.  So it's not obvious that full-featured shape inference will always be worth it.  Of course this is a philosophical statement; that's why concrete examples are always helpful to determine priorities.
